Eamonn Holmes was left drenched and freezing after Sir Ian McKellen and Ruth Langsford dumped buckets of ice water over his head on ITV‚Äôs This Morning. 
The broadcaster was taking part in the ice bucket challenge in aid of motor neurone disease, which was a social media phenomenon in 2014. 
Eamonn pledged to complete the challenge while presenting a Pride of Britain Award to Paula Maguire, a midwife from Barnsley who brought the challenge to the UK. Sir Ian, who was also presenting the award, asked: ‚ÄúCan I come along?‚Äù Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes at the Pride of Britain Awards (Ian West/PA) 
Speaking over the phone, Paula advised that Eamonn, 55, should go topless for the challenge, although he opted to wear a navy polo shirt. 
Out on the balcony of the building on London‚Äôs Embankment, the veteran 76-year-old actor was shown advising an apprehensive Eamonn not to back out: ‚ÄúThe nation would know, darling, they all heard you promise it. No, I think you‚Äôd better be a brave boy.‚Äù 
He added: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve done it, it‚Äôs quite bracing,‚Äù giving the broadcaster the option of having him and Ruth each throw a bucket in his face, or tip them over his head.
